title: Achieve 80%+ test coverage on core modules

task.title: Achieve 80%+ test coverage on core modules
task.description:
## Context
Ensure production-quality test coverage on core Toolsmith modules. Target 80%+ coverage on models, store, service.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 2h
**Approach:** Run coverage report, identify gaps, add tests for uncovered paths.

## Implementation Steps
1. Run coverage: `pytest tests/test_toolsmith/ --cov=src/cub/core/toolsmith --cov-report=html`
2. Review coverage report for gaps
3. Add tests for uncovered branches and edge cases
4. Focus on: error paths, edge cases, boundary conditions
5. Ensure models, store, service all exceed 80%
6. Source adapters can have lower coverage (network-dependent)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cub/core/toolsmith/models.py` >= 80% coverage
- [ ] `cub/core/toolsmith/store.py` >= 80% coverage
- [ ] `cub/core/toolsmith/service.py` >= 80% coverage
- [ ] `cub/core/toolsmith/search.py` >= 80% coverage (if separate)
- [ ] Error handling paths are tested
- [ ] Edge cases are tested (empty catalog, no results, etc.)
- [ ] All tests pass: `pytest tests/test_toolsmith/ -v`

## Files Likely Involved
- `tests/test_toolsmith/*.py` (modify/add)

## Notes
- Don't chase 100% coverage - focus on meaningful tests
- Source adapters may have lower coverage due to HTTP mocking complexity
- Use `# pragma: no cover` sparingly for truly untestable code
- Consider property-based testing for models (hypothesis)
